shell_commands.alias: Date and time {{date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}} to file

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Test non-ASCII characters: Å Ä Ö" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Terminal in test suite folder (No need to test)
Terminal in plugin folder (No need to test)
Test output to stderr, with exit code 0

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Multiline output" && echo "hides earlier lines." && echo "Only the last line is permanently displayed on the status bar."

platform_specific_commands.win32: echo Windows shell should be CMD: %COMSPEC% >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Bash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "Macintosh shell should be Bash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Zsh: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "Macintosh shell should be Zsh: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "This should NOT be written to TestResults.md!!!" {{passthrough:>>}} TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Dash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "Macintosh shell should be Dash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "YAML test: A1. "{{yaml_value:yaml_test1.first_item}}" A2. "{{yaml_value:yaml_test1.middle_item.inner_item}}" A3. "{{yaml_value:yaml_test1.last_item}}" B) first: "{{yaml_value:yaml_test2.0}}" B) second: "{{yaml_value:yaml_test2.1}}" B) last: "{{yaml_value:yaml_test2.-1}}" B) count: "{{yaml_value:yaml_test2.length}}  >> TestResults.md
echo "File extension: with dot: "{{file_extension:with-dot}}" / no dot: "{{file_extension:no-dot}} >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.win32: echo "File extension: with dot: {{file_extension:with-dot}} / no dot: {{file_extension:no-dot}}" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test output using Open a file 4

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Day of week: "{{date:dddd}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt mandatory field: "{{_mandatory_field}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field with a default value: "{{_field_with_default_value}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt optional field: "{{_optional_field}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field using variables: "{{_field_using_variables}} >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.win32: echo "Day of week: {{date:dddd}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt mandatory field: {{_mandatory_field}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field with a default value: {{_field_with_default_value}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt optional field: {{_optional_field}}" >> TestResults.md && echo "Prompt field using variables: {{_field_using_variables}}" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test custom variables and a prompt

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Custom variable 1: "{{_uri_custom_variable_1}} >> TestResults.md && echo "Custom variable 2: "{{_uri_custom_variable_2}} >> TestResults.md

echo Multiline >> TestResults.md
echo shell >> TestResults.md
echo command >> TestResults.md

prompts.title: Test prompt {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}

fields.label: Mandatory field
fields.description: 1. Try to submit the prompt without filling this, ensure an error message is shown saying that this field must be filled. 2. Type value: example

fields.label: Field using variables
fields.description: Check that the value is the current year by default, and then add {{file_name}} to the end (using the file_name variable).

custom_variables.name: optional_field
custom_variables.description: This should become an empty string.

custom_variables.name: uri_custom_variable_1
custom_variables.description: Used in Shell commands URI testing.

custom_variables.name: uri_custom_variable_2
custom_variables.description: Used in Shell commands URI testing.
